item.title: Obscura, an obscure new ransomware variant
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Huntress Labs
item.description: Huntress analysts discovered a previously unseen ransomware variant, Obscura, spreading from a victim company's domain controller. Learn how Obscura works—and what it means for defenders—in this week's Tradecraft Tuesday. [...]

item.title: Google: Brickstone malware used to steal U.S. orgs' data for over a year
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Suspected Chinese hackers have used the Brickstorm malware in long-term persistence espionage operations against U.S. organizations in the technology and legal sectors. [...]

item.title: UK arrests suspect for RTX ransomware attack causing airport disruptions
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The UK's National Crime Agency has arrested a suspect linked to a ransomware attack that is causing widespread disruptions across European airports. [...]

item.title: PyPI urges users to reset credentials after new phishing attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Python Software Foundation has warned victims of a new wave of phishing attacks using a fake Python Package Index (PyPI) website to reset credentials. [...]

item.title: GitHub notifications abused to impersonate Y Combinator for crypto theft
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A massive phishing campaign targeted GitHub users with cryptocurrency drainers, delivered via fake invitations to the Y Combinator (YC) W2026 program. [...]

item.title: Boyd Gaming discloses data breach after suffering a cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: US gaming and casino operator Boyd Gaming Corporation disclosed it suffered a breach after threat actors gained access to its systems and stole data, including employee information and data belonging to a limited number of other individuals. [...]

item.title: Libraesva ESG issues emergency fix for bug exploited by state hackers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Libraesva rolled out an emergency update for its Email Security Gateway solution to fix a vulnerability exploited by threat actors believed to be state sponsored. [...]

item.title: WhatsApp adds message translation to iPhone and Android apps
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: WhatsApp has started rolling out a new translation feature that enables Android and iPhone users to translate messages in chats, groups, and channel updates. [...]

item.title: Cloudflare mitigates new record-breaking 22.2 Tbps DDoS attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Cloudflare has mitigated a distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack that peaked at a record-breaking 22.2 terabits per second (Tbps) and 10.6 billion packets per second (Bpps). [...]

item.title: CISA says hackers breached federal agency using GeoServer exploit
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA has revealed that attackers breached the network of an unnamed U.S. federal civilian executive branch (FCEB) agency last year after compromising an unpatched GeoServer instance. [...]

item.title: Police dismantles crypto fraud ring linked to €100 million in losses
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Law enforcement authorities in Europe have arrested five suspects linked to a cryptocurrency investment fraud ring that stole over €100 million ($118 million) from more than 100 victims. [...]

item.title: 5 ways to streamline Identity Governance with this free tool
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by tenfold Software
item.description: Identity Governance doesn't have to be complex or costly. tenfold's free Community Edition helps orgs (up to 150 users) streamline onboarding, access reviews & M365 permissions — all with a no-code IGA platform. [...]

item.title: SolarWinds releases third patch to fix Web Help Desk RCE bug
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: SolarWinds has released a hotfix for a critical a critical vulnerability in Web Help Desk that allows remote code execution (RCE) without authentication. [...]
